original: Camitz, Helge Geoirg Botvid^, med. d!r, farm. kand., överläkare, Göteborg, f. 28/ 7/83 i S-trömstad av kapt. GeoTg C. o. Helga Essen. G. 27 m. Helny Maria Ekberg. Barn: Helga Marie-Louise f. 28, Elisabet 32. — Mog:ex. i Gbg 03, farm. kand. 06, med. kand. 08, med. lic. 13, med. dr 33, allt i Sthlm. Stud:-res. t. de skand. länd. samt t. USA 19-20, t. Engl., Frankr., Ital. o. Schweiz 23-24. Aman. v. Södra BB i Sthlm somm. 13, und:läk. v. Sundsvalls las. 14-15, v. Malmö allm. sjukh. 16-18, ledare f. Sv. Röda korsets ambulans t. Finl. 18, bitr. läk. v. Gbgs barnsjukh. 18-19, tf. las :läk. kort. tider i Eksjö 18 o. i Söderhamn 19, läk. v. Gbgs vanföreanst. sed. 20, överläk. där sed. 28. Marinläk :;stip. 10-12, marin-läk. av 2. gr. i res. 14-17, av 1. gr. 17. RNO, FFrK2kl.
translated: Camitz, Helge Georg Botvid, M.D., Pharmacist, Chief Physician, Gothenburg, b. 28/7/83 in Stromstad to Captain Georg C. and Helga Essen. Married 27 with Helny Maria Ekberg. Children: Helga Marie-Louise b. 28, Elisabet b. 32. Obtained degrees in medicine and pharmacy from Stockholm University in 03, 06, 08, 13, and 33. Travelled for study to Scandinavian countries and the USA in 19-20, and to England, France, Italy, and Switzerland in 23-24. Worked as an assistant physician at the Sodra Hospital in Stockholm in the summer of 13, and as an attending physician at Sundsvalls Hospital from 14-15, and at Malmo General Hospital from 16-18. Led the Swedish Red Cross ambulance to Finland in 18, served as an acting physician at Goteborg Children's Hospital from 18-19, temporary resident physician at Eksjo in 18 and Soderhamn in 19, physician at Goteborg's disability center since 20, and chief physician there since 28. Lieutenant at the Naval Medical College from 10-12, naval physician of the 2nd rank in the reserve from 14-17, and of the 1st rank in 17. Awarded the Order of the Polar Star and the French Legion of Honour 2nd class.
